channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How do you turn a baseball infield into a tennis court? It’s as complicated as it sounds
item.description: Tennis is experiencing a resurgence, with almost 26 million people playing in the U.S. alone. That number has been on an upward trajectory five years ...

item.title: U.S. vaccine advisers end decades-long recommendation for all babies to get a hepatitis B shot at birth
item.description: Several medical societies and state health departments said they would continue to recommend them.

item.title: So much of crypto is not even real—but that’s starting to change
item.description: Crypto has long felt like a giant casino with imaginary chips, but big recent breakthroughs mean it's fast becoming part of the real economy.

item.title: The Answer to the Return-to-Office Question Is More Nuanced That We Thought
item.description: Is going back to the office really all it’s cracked up to be?

item.title: Inside the Fortune 500 CEO pressure cooker: surviving is harder than ever and requires an ‘odd combination’ of traits
item.description: Mark Thompson is a top CEO coach and Byron Loflin is Nasdaq's in-house board whisperer. They told Fortune about joining forces for "CEO Ready."

item.title: Hershey’s Innovation Lab Just Created Its Own Dubai Chocolate Bar
item.description: You might have to temper your expectations—or find yourself a golden ticket.

item.title: UBS May Cut Further 10,000 Jobs by 2027
item.description: The bank did not confirm the number, but said it would ‘keep cuts as low as possible.’

item.title: Following in Paul Newman and Yvon Chouinard’s footsteps: There are more ways for leaders to give it away in ‘the Great Boomer Fire Sale’ than ever
item.description: As the president and CEO of Newman's Own, which gives away 100% of its profits, I am hearing from more and more business owners who want to try.

item.title: After Winning His First Oscar, Tom Cruise Kept Repeating the Same 2-Word Phrase. It’s a Lesson in Emotional Intelligence
item.description: It’s not surprising Tom Cruise would use this phrase after winning his first Oscar. But the fact he repeated it over 20 times, along with the way he y...

item.title: From ‘AI slop’ to ‘rage bait’: 2025’s words of the year represent digital disillusionment
item.description: Which terms best represent 2025? Every year, editors for publications ranging from the Oxford English Dictionary to the Macquarie Dictionary of Austra...

item.title: I analyzed thousands of TED Talks. Talking with hand gestures makes you look more competent
item.description: When people use hand gestures that visually represent what they’re saying, listeners see them as more clear, competent, and persuasive. That’s the key...

item.title: Costco Rival Brings Back Holiday Favorite Product
item.description: And it’s cheaper than the Kirkland version.

item.title: Supreme Court to reconsider a 90-year-old unanimous ruling that limits presidential power on removing heads of independent agencies
item.description: The court's conservatives, liberal Justice Elena Kagan noted in September, seem to be “raring to take that action.”

item.title: Black Friday was a big winner for live-shopping apps
item.description: This year’s busiest shopping day was a boon for live-shopping apps. Even at a time of inflation and economic uncertainty, Americans were ready to spen...

item.title: Housing market shift: Zillow’s updated ratings show the power balance in 250-plus metros
item.description: Want more housing market stories from Lance Lambert’s ResiClub in your inbox? Subscribe to the ResiClub newsletter . Zillow economists use an economic...
